abstract.text: The

class defines the visual appearance of pop-up buttons that display pop-up or pull-down menus. Pop-up menus present the user with a set of choices, much the way radio buttons do, but using much less space. Pull-down menus also provide a set of choices but present the information in a slightly different way, usually to provide a set of commands from which the user can choose.

Changes made to a menu (such as adding, removing, or changing the items) are not apparent while the menu is being displayed or interacted with.
property has no effect. The image displayed in a pop up button is taken from the selected menu item (in the case of a pop up menu) or from the first menu item (in the case of a pull-down menu).

The

class defines the visual appearance of pop-up buttons that display pop-up or pull-down menus. Pop-up menus present the user with a set of choices, much the way radio buttons do, but using much less space. Pull-down menus also provide a set of choices but present the information in a slightly different way, usually to provide a set of commands from which the user can choose.
Adds an item with the specified title to the end of the menu.
Adds multiple items to the end of the menu.
A Boolean value that indicates if the pop-up button links the state of the selected menu item to the current selection.
The position of the arrow displayed on the button.
Sets up the receiver to display a menu.
A Boolean value that indicates if the button automatically enables and disables its items every time a user event occurs.
Dismisses the pop-up button’s menu by ordering its window out.

Returns the index of the menu item that holds the specified represented object.
